ADVANCE PAY AND REPAYMENT POLICY  
This policy is designed to assist eligible employees in managing their financial needs by allowing them 
to request and receive a salary advance under specific conditions. It applies to all full -time employees 
who have completed at least one year of continu ous service. The policy outlines the eligibility criteria, 
application process, and repayment terms to ensure transparency, fairness, and consistency in the 
provision of salary advances. It excludes employees on probation or those who do not meet the 
minim um service requirement.  
Eligibility:  
Minimum Service Requirement:  
• Employees must have completed at least 6 months  of continuous service with the company.  
• The request for an advance shall be based on genuine financial hardship, medical emergencies, 
education expenses, marriage, or other valid reasons.  
• The employee does not have an existing outstanding advance.

• The employee does not have an existing outstanding advance.  
• Frequency of Advance: Employees are eligible to receive a salary advance only once every two 
years.  
Advance Amount :  
● Employees may request an advance of their monthly net salary.  
● The advance amount is subject to approval based on the company’s financial policies and the 
employee’s current financial standing with the company.  
Application Procedure:  
1. Advance Request: Employees must submit a written request over email for the advance to the HR 
department at least 30 days prior to the desired date of advance disbursement.  
2. Approval Process: The request will be reviewed by the HR department and, if approved, will be 
processed in accordance with the company's payroll schedule.  
3. Once an advance salary is disbursed to an employee, the same amount will be adjusted against their 
regular salary for that month. As a result, the employee will not be eligible to receive the same portion

of pay again during the month -end payroll or in the  same pay cycle, since it has already been paid in 
advance.  
Additional Terms:  
➢ Advance Revocation: The company reserves the right to revoke the approval of an advance under 
certain circumstances, such as a significant change in the employee’s financial status or disciplinary 
issues.

Attendance Regularization Process:  
What is Regularization?  
Regularization is the process of correcting or updating attendance records in the HRMS system (Keka) 
when an employee misses logging in or out on a workday or when there is an error in the recorded 
attendance.  
Regularization Limit:  
Employees are allowed to regularize up to 8 days of attendance per month in Keka. It's important to

use this option judiciously, as exceeding this limit is not permitted within the system.  
When to Regularize?  
If you miss logging in or out on a workday, or if there is a discrepancy in your attendance record (such 
as an incorrect punch time or a missed punch), you should initiate the regularization process as soon 
as possible.  
How to Regularize Attendance:  
1. Log into the Keka HRMS system.  
2. Navigate to the attendance section and identify the day(s) that require regularization.  
3. Select the "Regularize Attendance" option for the relevant date.  
4. Provide a valid reason for the regularization request (e.g., forgot to log in/out, system error, etc.)  
5. Submit the regularization request for approval.

Approval Process: Once the regularization request is submitted, it will be sent to your reporting 
manager for review. The manager will approve or deny the request based on the provided reason and 
overall attendance record.  
Tips for Avoiding Regularization:  
1. Daily Login/Logout: Make it a habit to log in and log out daily to avoid the need for regularization.  
2. Review Attendance Regularly: Check your attendance records weekly to catch any discrepancies 
early and correct them within the regularization limit.
